page.title: 02LOCAL ISSUE- SAND QUARRY.
page.content: In January 1984 planning application was made to the G.M.C by a firm to extract sand and gravel from a hill in the area north west of the village of Simister. The firm's intention was to excavate 1000 metric tons of gravel per week for four years and then to restore the site. This application caused a furore in the village. An Action Committte was formed, a protest meeting held in February, the support of M.P. David Sumberg and local councillors was successfully sought. The press and T.V were given interviews. However as the plan involved mineral extraction it had to be dealt with by G.M.C rather than the local council, the plan was appoved with conditions. A public enquiry was held in Bury and the result of the decision is now awaited from Dept of the Environment.
